CatDescriptText: Mr. Robert (Bob) Wallace, contractor, 71 Sylvania Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 6, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that too much leniency is shown teenagers who commit crimes?" answer reads: "Yes, I believe there is too much leniency shown, because the children of today get in trouble fast, and cause a lot of commotion. I think that if justice to teenaged criminals was handled differently there would be a lot of difference in conduct of teenagers."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Robert (Bob) Wallace wearing dark flecked three button coat, textured necktie with tie clip, moustache, and hat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
